newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -FTSE to weaken to 4,330 then stabilise.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -FTSE to weaken to 4,330 then stabilise.

text.p: The FTSE 100 will weaken to about 4,330 on Friday and then try to stabilise in response to last night's retreat on Wall Street, technical analysts said.
Although the next immediate support level is at 4,310-4,320, there is a chance the FTSE will edge a little higher from 4,330 but perhaps no higher than 4,350, they added.

Today's weakness may cause investors to re-examine their stock market strategy but in the recent past a sharp drop in prices has been an invitation to buy shares and some analysts believe this course of action may again be adopted.
By 0822 GMT, the FTSE was indicated down 22.6 at 4,333.5.
But an inspection of the chart of the FTSE shows intermediate support from 4,320.
Market volatility may be high in early trading owing to traders closing positions ahead of the February FTSE options expiry, but after that, analysts expect the market to be calmer.

Total market turnover should be monitored closely for the intensity of today's selling pressure because the higher the turnover today, the more difficult it will be to arrest this morning's fall and to instigate a market turnaround, they added.
